name: UNHEARD 2025: Make Resonant Machines with Sky Kung
location: Terrible Baby, Music Room, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road Hong Kong, KOW
about: Join Sky Kung in this hands-on workshop to build an electroacoustic instrument that transforms everyday materials into evolving soundscapes. Participants will experiment with vibrating plates made of metal, wood, springs, and other objects using transducers and motors. The resulting resonances will be captured with contact microphones and shaped through an internal feedback circuit to explore drones, textures, and sonic unpredictability.This workshop is ideal for anyone interested in building electroacoustic instruments. No prior experience in DIY electronics is required, though some familiarity with playing musical instruments is preferred. Participants will get hands-on experience soldering components to a PCB, and experimenting with transducers and contact mics to discover new sounds.Sky Kung is a Hong Kong-based media artist, music producer, and instrument maker. His works across Sound Art, Performance and Device Making. His practice seeks to expand artistic potential, empowering creators to shape their own tools, while bridging technical experimentation with expressive freedom.â He is the 2025 Sonic Transmission Artist-in-Residence at CMHK and recently completed a residency at iii (instrument inventor initiative) in The Hague. The instrument created in this workshop is inspired by the ideas and insights he gained during that residency.As a guitarist in the band Lucid Express, he creates dreamlike textures with effect pedals while also designing his own, combining digital signal processing and analog circuitry.Bi- lingual (Cantonese & English)åŠ å…¥ Sky Kung çš„é€™å€‹å¯¦è¸å·¥ä½œåŠï¼Œæ‰“é€ ä¸€å€‹é›»è²æ¨‚å™¨ï¼Œå°‡æ—¥å¸¸ææ–™è½‰åŒ–ç‚ºä¸æ–·è®ŠåŒ–çš„è²éŸ³æ™¯è§€ã€‚åƒåŠ è€…å°‡ä½¿ç”¨æ›èƒ½å™¨å’Œé¦¬é”å¯¦é©—é‡‘å±¬ã€æœ¨æã€å½ˆç°§å’Œå…¶ä»–ç‰©å“è£½ä½œçš„æŒ¯å‹•æ¿ã€‚ç”¢ç”Ÿçš„å…±é³´å°‡é€šéæ¥è§¸éº¥å…‹é¢¨æ•æ‰ï¼Œä¸¦ç¶“ç”±å…§éƒ¨åé¥‹é›»è·¯å¡‘é€ ï¼Œä»¥æ¢ç´¢ç„¡äººæ©Ÿã€è³ªæ„Ÿå’Œè²éŸ³çš„ä¸å¯é æ¸¬æ€§ã€‚é€™å€‹å·¥ä½œåŠéå¸¸é©åˆä»»ä½•å°æ§‹å»ºé›»è²æ¨‚å™¨æ„Ÿèˆˆè¶£çš„äººã€‚ç„¡éœ€å…·å‚™ DIY é›»å­å­¸çš„å…ˆå‰ç¶“é©—ï¼Œä½†å°æ–¼æ¼”å¥æ¨‚å™¨æœ‰ä¸€å®šç†Ÿæ‚‰åº¦è€…å°‡æ›´ä½³ã€‚åƒåŠ è€…å°‡ç²å¾—å¯¦éš›ç¶“é©—ï¼Œå°‡å…ƒä»¶ç„Šæ¥åˆ° PCBï¼Œä¸¦å¯¦é©—æ›èƒ½å™¨å’Œæ¥è§¸éº¥å…‹é¢¨ï¼Œä»¥ç™¼ç¾æ–°è²éŸ³ã€‚Sky Kung æ˜¯ä¸€ä½é§æ¸¯çš„åª’é«”è—è¡“å®¶ã€éŸ³æ¨‚è£½ä½œäººå’Œæ¨‚å™¨è£½ä½œäººã€‚ä»–çš„ä½œå“æ¶‰åŠè²éŸ³è—è¡“ã€è¡¨æ¼”å’Œè¨­å‚™è£½ä½œã€‚ä»–çš„å¯¦è¸æ—¨åœ¨æ“´å±•è—è¡“æ½›èƒ½ï¼Œè³¦äºˆå‰µä½œè€…å¡‘é€ è‡ªå·±å·¥å…·çš„èƒ½åŠ›ï¼ŒåŒæ™‚å°‡æŠ€è¡“å¯¦é©—èˆ‡è¡¨é”è‡ªç”±ç›¸çµåˆã€‚ä»–æ˜¯2025å¹´ CMHK çš„è²éŸ³å‚³éè—è¡“é§ç•™è—è¡“å®¶ï¼Œæœ€è¿‘åœ¨æµ·ç‰™çš„ iiiï¼ˆæ¨‚å™¨ç™¼æ˜å€¡è­°ï¼‰å®Œæˆäº†ä¸€å€‹é§ç•™è¨ˆåŠƒã€‚æœ¬å·¥ä½œåŠä¸­å‰µé€ çš„æ¨‚å™¨éˆæ„Ÿä¾†è‡ªæ–¼ä»–åœ¨è©²é§ç•™æœŸé–“ç²å¾—çš„æƒ³æ³•å’Œè¦‹è§£ã€‚ä½œç‚ºæ¨‚éšŠ Lucid Express çš„å‰ä»–æ‰‹ï¼Œä»–ä½¿ç”¨æ•ˆæœè¸æ¿å‰µé€ å¤¢å¹»èˆ¬çš„è³ªæ„Ÿï¼ŒåŒæ™‚è¨­è¨ˆè‡ªå·±çš„æ•ˆæœå™¨ï¼Œçµåˆæ•¸å­—ä¿¡è™Ÿè™•ç†å’Œæ¨¡æ“¬é›»è·¯ã€‚è¬›åº§å°‡ä»¥é›™èªï¼ˆå»£æ±è©±å’Œè‹±èªï¼‰é€²è¡Œã€‚

name: UNHEARD 2025: Into the Vapor: a foray into an Internet Electronic Genre
location: Terrible Baby, Music Room, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road Hong Kong, KOW
about: A brief journey through the first decade of vaporwave (an acousmatic, sampling-based genre of internet music) - and its offshoots - in the form of a playlist with artist's favourite selections.Angus Lee (b. 1992) is a Hongkong-born performer-composer who has appeared in international music festivals across North America, Asia, continental Europe and the UK. He has been a musician of the Hong Kong New Ensemble since 2016, and has been a full time faculty member of The University of Hong Kong's Music Department since 2022. His current doctoral research combines his creative compositional work with an investigation of the internet music genre, _vaporwave_. In his (almost non-existent) spare time outside of practising, rehearsing, performing, composing and teaching, he is an avid reader of philosophy and political theory, and enjoys swimming, hiking and playing badminton.Talk will be Bi- lingual (Cantonese & English)å°æ–¼è’¸æ±½æ³¢ï¼ˆé€™æ˜¯ä¸€ç¨®åŸºæ–¼è²éŸ³å’Œå–æ¨£çš„ç¶²è·¯éŸ³æ¨‚é¡å‹ï¼‰åŠå…¶è¡ç”Ÿå½¢å¼çš„ç¬¬ä¸€å€‹åå¹´çš„ç°¡è¦æ—…ç¨‹ï¼Œä»¥è—è¡“å®¶çš„æœ€æ„›é¸æ›²çš„æ’­æ”¾åˆ—è¡¨å½¢å¼å‘ˆç¾ã€‚Angus Leeï¼ˆ1992å¹´ç”Ÿï¼‰æ˜¯ä¸€ä½å‡ºç”Ÿæ–¼é¦™æ¸¯çš„è¡¨æ¼”è€…å’Œä½œæ›²å®¶ï¼Œæ›¾åƒåŠ åŒ—ç¾ã€äºæ´²ã€å¤§é™¸æ­æ´²å’Œè‹±åœ‹çš„åœ‹éš›éŸ³æ¨‚ç¯€ã€‚è‡ª2016å¹´ä»¥ä¾†ï¼Œä»–ä¸€ç›´æ˜¯é¦™æ¸¯æ–°éŸ³æ¨‚åœ˜çš„éŸ³æ¨‚å®¶ï¼Œä¸¦è‡ª2022å¹´èµ·æˆç‚ºé¦™æ¸¯å¤§å­¸éŸ³æ¨‚ç³»çš„å…¨è·æ•™å“¡ã€‚ä»–ç›®å‰çš„åšå£«ç ”ç©¶çµåˆäº†ä»–çš„å‰µä½œä½œæ›²å·¥ä½œèˆ‡å°ç¶²è·¯éŸ³æ¨‚é¡å‹è’¸æ±½æ³¢çš„æ¢è¨ã€‚åœ¨ä»–å¹¾ä¹ä¸å­˜åœ¨çš„ç©ºé–’æ™‚é–“è£¡ï¼Œä»–ç†±è¡·æ–¼é–±è®€å“²å­¸å’Œæ”¿æ²»ç†è«–ï¼Œä¸¦å–œæ­¡æ¸¸æ³³ã€å¥è¡Œå’Œæ‰“ç¾½æ¯›çƒã€‚è¬›åº§å°‡ä»¥é›™èªï¼ˆå»£æ±è©±å’Œè‹±èªï¼‰é€²è¡Œã€‚

name: UNHEARD 2025: A2B x Mystery Train presents GNX by Kendrick Lamar
location: Terrible Baby, Music Room, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road Hong Kong, KOW
about: In this session of A2B, Eaton's ongoing vinyl- sharing series, James of Eaton Radio HK's Mystery Train podcast will lead the talk and listening session to deconstruct and demystify the themes, sounds and inspirations behind Kendrick Lamar's recent work, GNX. Hailing from California's Bay Area, where much of the album's sound can be attributed to, James who was raised on hip hop and Mystery Train co-host Cheryl will offer their analysis on the themes and decisions that went into the release and what propelled it's popularity.A2B is Eaton's ongoing vinyl- sharing series, where guests are invited to speak at length about an important or seminal work in their music- listening experience and Mystery Train is a radio show on Eaton Radio HK hosted by Cheryl Chow and James Acey where they pick songs from the mystery box and talk about music life and everything in between.Talk to be held in Englishåœ¨é€™ä¸€å ´ A2B ä¸­ï¼ŒEaton çš„é»‘è† åˆ†äº«ç³»åˆ—Eaton Radio HK çš„ã€ŠMystery Trainã€‹æ’­å®¢ä¸»æŒäºº James å°‡ä¸»æŒä¸€å ´è¬›åº§å’Œè†è½ç’°ç¯€ï¼Œæ·±å…¥å‰–æå’Œè§£å¯† Kendrick Lamar æœ€è¿‘çš„ä½œå“ã€ŠGNXã€‹ä¸­çš„ä¸»é¡Œã€è²éŸ³å’Œéˆæ„Ÿã€‚James ä¾†è‡ªåŠ å·ç£å€ï¼Œè©²è™•çš„éŸ³æ¨‚é¢¨æ ¼å°å°ˆè¼¯çš„è²éŸ³å½±éŸ¿æ·±é ï¼Œè€Œä»–åœ¨å˜»å“ˆéŸ³æ¨‚ä¸­é•·å¤§ï¼ŒåŠ ä¸Šã€ŠMystery Trainã€‹çš„å…±åŒä¸»æŒ Cherylï¼Œå°‡æä¾›å°å°ˆè¼¯ä¸»é¡Œå’Œç™¼è¡Œæ±ºç­–çš„åˆ†æï¼Œä»¥åŠä¿ƒä½¿å…¶å—æ­¡è¿çš„åŸå› ã€‚A2B æ˜¯ Eaton æŒçºŒé€²è¡Œçš„é»‘è† åˆ†äº«ç³»åˆ—ï¼Œé‚€è«‹å˜‰è³“æ·±å…¥è¨è«–åœ¨ä»–å€‘çš„éŸ³æ¨‚è†è½ç¶“é©—ä¸­é‡è¦æˆ–å…·æœ‰é–‹å‰µæ€§çš„ä½œå“ã€‚ã€ŠMystery Trainã€‹æ˜¯ Eaton Radio HK ä¸Šç”± Cheryl Chow å’Œ James Acey ä¸»æŒçš„å»£æ’­ç¯€ç›®ï¼Œä»–å€‘å¾ç¥ç§˜ç›’å­ä¸­æŒ‘é¸æ­Œæ›²ï¼Œä¸¦è¨è«–éŸ³æ¨‚ç”Ÿæ´»åŠå…¶é–“çš„é»æ»´ã€‚è¬›åº§å°‡ä»¥è‹±èªé€²è¡Œã€‚

name: UNHEARD 2025: Staying (un)derground between safe & dangerous
location: Kino, Eaton House (Co-working), 380 Nathan Road 1/F Hong Kong, KOW
about: This panel brings together K41, a club space rooted in Ukraineâ€™s underground culture, alongside Hong Kong collectives Panic Library and Shimai Tribe. Together, they reflect on the tensions of staying under the radar and how underground spaces can offer both refuge and risk, resistance and exposure.  The conversation will explore how communities navigate visibility, care, survival, and creative expression amid political, social, and spatial precarity.

name: UNHEARD 2025: Searching Out, Saving, and Sounding Spaces
location: Terrible Baby, Music Room, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road Hong Kong, KOW
about: This presentation will introduce Edward Sanderson's research into the spaces for sound art and experimental music as they have developed in the Chinese Mainland and Hong Kong, and describe some of my recent activities based on this research.For the last 15 years or so he has focused on spaces for sound art and experimental music and spatially-related practices that find their homes in these spaces. Geographically, he restricts himself to the Chinese Mainland and Hong Kong (already a huge area), and the period is from the late 1990s to the present day, although he also deals with some earlier material for context. This research has led him to build up a physical archive of material, currently based in Hong Kong, and from this I have produced various texts, events, and curated exhibitions.This talk will be structured around four important stages in the development of this research: His PhD at HK Baptist University's Academy of Visual Art; the 2023 â€œSounds Like Printâ€ display at Tai Kwun Contemporary; the recently concluded exhibition â€œIt Always Sounds Somewhereâ€ at the Inside-Out Art Museum in Beijing; and the performance series â€œExit-Entryâ€ which invites Mainland artists to perform alongside local artists, and which serves as a further means to promote connections and knowledge sharing between the Chinese Mainland and Hong Kong._______________Bio:Dr. Edward Sanderson is a researcher and curator focusing on contemporary non-mainstream sonic practices from the Chinese Mainland and Hong Kong. In 2025 Edward curated the exhibition "It Always Sounds Somewhere" at Inside-Out Art Museum in Beijing, presenting an extensive set of installations of the multiple forms of space used for sound art and experimental music, supplemented by a series of related performances and talks. Edward is currently developing a physical and online archive of sound-related material, and co-curating the Exit-Entry performance series bringing together Chinese Mainland and local artists to play in Hong Kongâ€™s underground venues.Talk to be held in Englishé€™å ´æ¼”è¬›å°‡ä»‹ç´¹ Edward Sanderson å°ä¸­åœ‹å¤§é™¸å’Œé¦™æ¸¯è²éŸ³è—è¡“åŠå¯¦é©—éŸ³æ¨‚ç©ºé–“çš„ç ”ç©¶ï¼Œä¸¦æè¿°ä»–åŸºæ–¼é€™é …ç ”ç©¶æ‰€é€²è¡Œçš„ä¸€äº›è¿‘æœŸæ´»å‹•ã€‚åœ¨éå»çš„15å¹´å·¦å³ï¼Œä»–å°ˆæ³¨æ–¼è²éŸ³è—è¡“å’Œå¯¦é©—éŸ³æ¨‚çš„ç©ºé–“ï¼Œä»¥åŠåœ¨é€™äº›ç©ºé–“ä¸­ç™¼å±•çš„èˆ‡ç©ºé–“ç›¸é—œçš„å¯¦è¸ã€‚ä»–çš„ç ”ç©¶åœ°ç†ç¯„åœé™æ–¼ä¸­åœ‹å¤§é™¸å’Œé¦™æ¸¯ï¼ˆå·²ç¶“æ˜¯ä¸€å€‹ç›¸ç•¶é¾å¤§çš„å€åŸŸï¼‰ï¼Œç ”ç©¶æ™‚é–“å¾1990å¹´ä»£æœ«åˆ°ç¾åœ¨ï¼ŒåŒæ™‚ä»–ä¹Ÿæœƒæ¶‰åŠä¸€äº›æ—©æœŸçš„ææ–™ä»¥æä¾›èƒŒæ™¯ã€‚é€™é …ç ”ç©¶ä½¿ä»–å»ºç«‹äº†ä¸€å€‹å¯¦é«”æª”æ¡ˆåº«ï¼Œç›®å‰ä½æ–¼é¦™æ¸¯ï¼Œä¸¦ç”±æ­¤ç”¢ç”Ÿäº†å„ç¨®æ–‡æœ¬ã€æ´»å‹•å’Œç­–å±•å±•è¦½ã€‚é€™å ´æ¼”è¬›å°‡åœç¹é€™é …ç ”ç©¶ç™¼å±•çš„å››å€‹é‡è¦éšæ®µé€²è¡Œï¼šä»–åœ¨é¦™æ¸¯æµ¸æœƒå¤§å­¸è¦–è¦ºè—è¡“å­¸é™¢çš„åšå£«å­¸ä½ï¼›2023å¹´åœ¨å¤§é¤¨ç•¶ä»£è—è¡“ä¸­å¿ƒçš„â€œSounds Like Printâ€å±•è¦½ï¼›æœ€è¿‘çµæŸçš„åŒ—äº¬ Inside-Out è—è¡“åšç‰©é¤¨çš„å±•è¦½â€œå®ƒç¸½æ˜¯åœ¨æŸè™•éŸ¿èµ·â€ï¼›ä»¥åŠâ€œExit-Entryâ€è¡¨æ¼”ç³»åˆ—ï¼Œé‚€è«‹å¤§é™¸è—è¡“å®¶èˆ‡æœ¬åœ°è—è¡“å®¶å…±åŒè¡¨æ¼”ï¼Œé€²ä¸€æ­¥ä¿ƒé€²ä¸­åœ‹å¤§é™¸èˆ‡é¦™æ¸¯ä¹‹é–“çš„è¯ç¹«å’ŒçŸ¥è­˜åˆ†äº«ã€‚_______________ç°¡ä»‹ï¼šEdward Sanderson åšå£«æ˜¯ä¸€ä½ç ”ç©¶è€…å’Œç­–å±•äººï¼Œå°ˆæ³¨æ–¼ä¾†è‡ªä¸­åœ‹å¤§é™¸å’Œé¦™æ¸¯çš„ç•¶ä»£éä¸»æµè²éŸ³å¯¦è¸ã€‚åœ¨2025å¹´ï¼ŒEdward åœ¨åŒ—äº¬ Inside-Out è—è¡“åšç‰©é¤¨ç­–åŠƒäº†å±•è¦½â€œå®ƒç¸½æ˜¯åœ¨æŸè™•éŸ¿èµ·â€ï¼Œå±•ç¤ºäº†å¤šç¨®ç”¨æ–¼è²éŸ³è—è¡“å’Œå¯¦é©—éŸ³æ¨‚çš„ç©ºé–“å½¢å¼çš„å®‰è£ä½œå“ï¼Œä¸¦è¼”ä»¥ä¸€ç³»åˆ—ç›¸é—œçš„è¡¨æ¼”å’Œè¬›åº§ã€‚Edward æ­£åœ¨é–‹ç™¼ä¸€å€‹èˆ‡è²éŸ³ç›¸é—œçš„å¯¦é«”å’Œåœ¨ç·šæª”æ¡ˆåº«ï¼Œä¸¦å…±åŒç­–åŠƒ Exit-Entry è¡¨æ¼”ç³»åˆ—ï¼Œå°‡ä¸­åœ‹å¤§é™¸è—è¡“å®¶å’Œæœ¬åœ°è—è¡“å®¶èšé›†åœ¨é¦™æ¸¯çš„åœ°ä¸‹å ´åœ°æ¼”å‡ºã€‚è¬›åº§å°‡ä»¥è‹±èªé€²è¡Œã€‚

name: UNHEARD 2025: SOSOS presents: Open Session with SOPHY
location: Kino, Eaton House (Co-working), 380 Nathan Road 1/F Hong Kong, KOW
about: Open Session is an artist-led conversation and listening event curated by singer-songwriter & producer SOPHY under her independent label, SOSOS. Each session invites musicians and creatives whom SOPHY has collaborated with to share behind-the-scenes insights and engage in meaningful dialogue with a live audience. Open to the public, the series aims to foster deeper artistic exchange and strengthen connections within Hong Kongâ€™s creative community. SOSOS is an independent label and music production studio founded by Hong Kong singer-songwriter and producer SOPHY. It brings together artists, musicians, and creatives through record production, cross-disciplinary projects, and cultural events like the Open Session series. SOSOS is dedicated to amplifying emerging voices, sparking honest dialogue, and building a more connected, supportive creative community in Hong Kong and beyond.

name: UNHEARD 2025: Eaton Tapes Live by Ink Element
location: Terrible Baby, Music Room, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road Hong Kong, KOW
about: "THE EATON TAPES" is an album released on March 2025. It represents a true cross-cultural exchange of ideas, techniques, and musical expressions. This six-month musical journey  began at the Unheard festival last year and eventually led to a collection of 12 songs by 5 artists.The Ink Element performance takes the songs written by the French producer and brings them to stage, along with previously unreleased material of his next album (Strollers on the highway) and some highlights of his portfolio.Ink Element is a Hong-Kong based artist who transcends boundaries between experimental electronic and alternative rock, creating immersive sonic journeys ranging from 4 to 12 minutes.Blending house/techno rhythms with indie rock influences, organic drum kits, evolving synthesizers, and both instrumental and vocal compositions.The artist has released 3 albums, 4 EPs and 6 singles in the past three years, compiling multiple tunes, creating on stage, unveiling new tracks at every show, which makes every stage performance unique.

name: UNHEARD 2025: A fling into the vibe of Pure LoFi (Arturia)
location: Terrible Baby, Music Room, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road Hong Kong, KOW
about: Pure LoFi is a software instrument dedicated to sounds with personality and attitude. If you had only one synthesizer to compose a soundtrack for exploring abandoned 1980s shopping malls, the catacombs under Paris, or the endless â€œbackroomsâ€ of internet lore, Pure LoFi would be it. This workshop introduces sound explorers to new landscapes they can design, sculpt and shape with audacity and style. Workshop to be led by Ink Element. Ink Element transcends boundaries between experimental electronic and alternative rock,creating immersive sonic journeys ranging from 4 to 12 minutes. Blending house/technorhythms with organic drum kits, evolving synthesizers, and both instrumental and vocalcompositions.
